Description: More than 43 million of user records from UK-based music streaming service Last.fm surfaced from a hack that occurred in 2012. Each record reportedly contains a username, email address, hashed password and profile data.

Author: APT3
Description: Security company FireEye reveals that two Hong Kong government agencies have come under attack from cyberspies originating in China in the month leading up to Sunday’s legislative elections.

LeakedSource reveals that Btc-E.com had 568,355 users hacked in October of 2014. Data contains usernames, emails, passwords, ip addresses, register dates, languages and some internal data such as how many coins the user had.

LeakedSource reveals that Bitcointalk.org had 499,593 users hacked in May of 2015. Data contains usernames, emails, passwords, birthdays, secret questions, hashed secret answers and some other internal data.
Over 1,000 former students and employees of UNM have their identity stolen from a University database. After a month of silence, UNM establishes a call center to assist victims of the incident.

Developers of the Transmission BitTorrent client admitted that hackers replaced downloads of its file-sharing software with trojanized code. The hack, detected within hours, was designed to spread a Mac OS X backdoor, Kidnap, which steals user credentials. It’s unclear how many people were affected.

Author: Ghost Squad Hackers (GSH)
Target: 12 websites belonging to the Afghan government
Description: Hacktivist group Ghost Squad Hackers (GSH) defaced 12 websites belonging to the Afghan government.

Author: Expl.oit AKA Exploit
Description: A group of hackers going by the online handle of “Expl.oit” or “Exploit” hack the official website of Exile Mod gaming forum and leaks personal details of 11,902 registered users.
The non-profit organization Man Alive is hacked, and a patient database with sensitive personal and treatment information is put up for sale on the dark web.

Author: websites-hunter AKA @websitehunter
Description: The Al Zahra Private Medical Centre is hacked by an individual calling himself websites-hunter, who dumps the database online.
Tags: websites-hunter, @websitehunter, Al Zahra Private Medical Centre, alzahra.com

Description: Linode reports the first of a series of DoS attacks on September 2nd, September 4th and September 5th. Another round will strike the company on Saturday, September 10th. Some of the attacks lasted up to eight hours.
Hutton Hotel reports a breach of its payment card system warning guests that their information may have been compromised

Author: Anti-Armenia Team
Description: Azerbaijani hacktivists from Anti-Armenia Team leak the passport details of foreign visitors to Armenia and more after breaking into Armenian government servers.

Point of sales vendor Lightspeed is breached with password, customer data, and API keys possibly exposed, and notifies customers in an email saying that the information was contained in a compromised database

Author: OurMine
Description: Entertainment news site Variety is briefly taken over by the infamous hacker group OurMine. The hacking collective manages to break into Variety's content management system and defaces the site with a post of their own claiming responsibility for the attack. The group also floods the site's email subscribers' inboxes with dozens of identical emails

Author: Spain Squad
Description: A group of hackers dubbed Spain Squad claims to have found a way to seize inactive and suspended Twitter accounts, and sells them on the social network.

Author: Myrotvorets
Description: Myrotvorets, a group of Ukrainian nationalist hackers, leaks the personal details of local journalists they consider pro-Russian for the second time in four months.
Nearly 800,000 accounts for popular porn site Brazzers have been exposed in a data breach

Author: DayKalif
Description: Nearly 100 million usernames and passwords from the Russian internet giant Rambler surface online in the latest in a long line of hacks that first occurred back in 2012.
University of Alaska officials announces that an attacker using employee credentials may have accessed student information of approximately 5,400 individuals.

Author: North Korea?
Description: Servers belonging to the Project on Crowdsourced Imagery Analysis (PCIA), hosting data about nuclear tests, have been the subject of DDoS attacks just two days before North Korea's most recent nuclear tests.
Tags: Project on Crowdsourced Imagery Analysis, geo4nonpro.org, North Korea

Author: Aslan Neferler Tim or Lion Soldiers Team
Description: Austrian police investigates a failed cyberattack on Vienna's airport saying they are looking into the authenticity of a claim of responsibility from a Turkish nationalist group.
Tags: Aslan Neferler Tim, Lion Soldiers Team, Vienna Airport

Description: The Hutton Hotel says it engaged a third-party cyber security firm after it was notified of a possible breach by its payment processor. The investigation found that malware designed to capture card data had been installed on the hotel's payment processing system.

Popular science website EurekAlert!, which handles embargoed reports on health, medicine, and technology is hacked. The announcement in the website states that usernames and passwords to the service have been compromised. The hacker has also leaks two embargoed reports.

vDos, a “booter” service that has earned in excess of $600,000 over the past two years helping customers coordinate more than 150,000 DDoS attacks is massively hacked, spilling secrets about tens of thousands of paying customers and their targets.
The database of the Italian portal libero.it is leaked online (about 750,000 users).
Telephony provider VolPtalk may have been hit by hackers. The firm discreetly informs customers about a potential data breach and request to reset their passwords as a precautionary measure.

Security researcher Brian Krebs' website KrebsOnSecurity comes under "heavy and sustainable" attack after two 18 year-old Israeli hackers were arrested over their connection with a DDoS-for-hire service called vDOS.

Author: Aslan Neferler Tim or Lion Soldiers Team
Description: Turkish hackers have launched DoS (Denial-of-Service) attacks against the web servers of the Austrian National Bank (OeNB).
Tags: Aslan Neferler Tim, Lion Soldiers Team, Austrian National Bank (OeNB.at)

Description: Hackers steal 22 gigabytes of data from municipal servers in Almelo

Author: Daykalif
Description: QIP.ru is the latest organization to join the list of companies hit by mega breaches. A hacker dubbed daykalif dumps a trove of 33 million accounts.

Author: B0yzTeam
Description: A group of cyber criminals defaces the official website of Bremerton Housing Authority (bremertonhousing.org) and demands $4,000 as ransom.

Author: APT28 AKA Fancy Bear
Description: The World Anti-Doping Agency (Wada) confirms that a suspected Russian hacking group illegally accessed its 'administration and management system' - known as 'Adams' and stole troves of sensitive data on athletes. Among those targeted are Serena and Venus Williams, gymnast Simone Biles, and American basketball star Elena Delle Donne. Compromised information includes confidential medical data, such as Therapeutic Use Exemptions,
Tags: APT28, Fancy Bear, World Anti-Doping Agency, WADA, Serena Williams, Venus Williams, Simone Biles, Elena Delle Donne

Description: Plaintext passwords, usernames, e-mail addresses, and other personal information for more than 2.2 million people who created accounts with ClixSense are published online. The attackers claim to release additional 4.4 million accounts.
Thousands of Seagate Central network-attached storage (NAS) devices have been found hosting cryptocurrency mining malware called Miner-C which turns them into repositories to infect other devices.
St. Francis Health System is hacked and the data is sold on the Dark Web for 24 BTC (14,500 USD, 11,000 GBP, 13,000 EUR)
Empireminecraft notifies its users of the compromise of one of the staff member's email account. As a result the attacker was able to access confidential information.

Author: MuslimLeets (aka Muj4hida)
Target: American Human Rights Council (AHRC.org) and 62 other websites
Description: A hacker going by the name MuslimLeets (aka Muj4hida) defaces the American Human Rights Council (AHRC) and 62 other websites, leaving a message calling for jihad.
Tags: MuslimLeets, Muj4hida, American Human Rights Council, AHRC.org

Description: SS&C Technologies, falls victim of China-based hackers who sent a fake emails to company staffers in order to trick them into releasing client money, according to a complaint.

Author: PoodleCorp
Description: Blizzard's Battle.net servers are knocked offline by yet another denial-of-service (DDoS) attack claimed by hacking group PoodleCorp.

Author: Fear
Target: Hundreds of US government servers hosted on .us and .gov
Description: A teenage hacker going by the pseudonym Fear claimed that he has gained access to hundreds of US government servers hosted on .us and .gov domains and stolen a massive trove of personal information of US citizens (among which 100 million Social Security Numbers).

Author:
Anonymous Italia
 Antisec-Italia
Description: In name of #OpSafePharma, the Italian hacktivists hack four healthcare organizations and leak data from two.
Saint Francis Health System acknowledges the hack of 6,000 names and addresses.
Modaco.com, a UK-based forum dedicated to the the Android operating system is breached, with nearly 800,000 usernames and passwords stolen by hackers. The attack dates back to January 2016
The website for Just For Men, a company that sells various products for men is compromised to serve malware to its visitors.

Hackers claim to have hacked Australian point-of-sale technology (PoS) company H&L Australia, and offer the database for sale. They were already offering it for sale for AU$22,000 ($16,580, £12,723) more than two months ago.

Yahoo! Inc. (NASDAQ:YHOO) confirms that a copy of certain user account information was stolen from the company's network in late 2014. The account information may have included names, email addresses, telephone numbers, dates of birth, hashed passwords (the vast majority with bcrypt) and, in some cases, encrypted or unencrypted security questions and answers.
Ethereum, a public blockchain-based decentralised computing platform for the cryptocurrency Ether is targeted by a DDoS attack on its network, causing all mining activities to slow down.

Author: Unnamed group of Russian Criminals
Description: Ed Alexander, a darknet investigator reveals that a group of Russian hackers launched cyberattacks to steal user credentials from at least 85 companies. Targets include Amazon, American Airlines, AT&T, Best Buy, Wells Fargo, DropBox, Dunkin Donuts, Ebay, GoDaddy, Uber, Match.com, McDonald’s, Office Depot, PayPal, Pizza Hut, Steam, Apple Pay, and others.
Tags: Russia, Amazon, American Airlines, AT&T, Best Buy, Wells Fargo, DropBox, Dunkin Donuts, Ebay, GoDaddy, Uber, Match.com, McDonald’s, Office Depot, PayPal, Pizza Hut, Steam, Apple Pay

Description: An image purported to be a scanned copy of U.S. first lady Michelle Obama’s passport is leaked online alongside personal emails said to belong to a low-level White House staffer who worked with Hillary Clinton’s presidential campaign.
Hosting company OVH is subject to the biggest attack DDoS known to date, with peaks of over 1 Tb per second of traffic.

Author: Black Team
Description: An investigation by InfoArmor reveals that Cybercrime syndicate Black Team is spreading its new malicious tool “RAUM” that drops malware on victims’ devices with a torrent file.

hacker or hackers associated with a former Palm Beach County Sheriff’s Office deputy who has a long-standing dispute with Florida law enforcement that appears to have gotten him raided by the FBI managed A hacker manages to access and acquire what appears to be the entire database of Florida Bar Association (floridabar.org)

Author: Bundeswehr’s Computer Network Operations Unit (CNO)
Description: Der Spiegel reveals that the Bundeswehr's (German Armed Forces) special cyber unit is believed to have conducted the nation's first known "offensive" cyber operation in 2015, when it hacked into the network of an Afghan mobile network provider.
Tags: Bundeswehr’s Computer Network Operations Unit, CNO, Der Spiegel

Author: "Crafty Cockney" (Nathan Wyatt?)
Description: Pippa Middleton falls fallen victim to an iCloud hacker after an anonymous seller calling himself 'Crafty Cockney' offers to sell 3,000 private photographs of her and fiance James Matthews to the press for £50,000. A 35-year-old man Nathan Wyatt is arrested shortly after.
Tags: Pippa Middleton, James Matthews, Crafty Cockney, James Matthews, iCloud

Author: Guccifer 2.0
Description: Guccifer 2.0 releases a new cache of documents from the DCCC (Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee).
Tags: Guccifer 2.0, DCCC, Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee

Description: Software house Jive resets customers passwords after the company discovered a data breach.
Office supplies firm AF Smith suspends sales on its Apple website amid fears over credit-card hacking.

Author: Monte Melkonian Cyber Army (MMCA)
Target: Several Azeri embassies and government websites
Description: Armenian hackers from Monte Melkonian Cyber Army (MMCA) leak personal details of several Azeri government officials and also deface several Azeri embassy and government sites to celebrate 25 years of Armenian independence.

Author: Fancy Bear, APT28
Description: Researchers from Palo Alto reveals the details of Komplex, a sophisticated piece of malware designed to infect computer systems running Apple OSX.
Un unknown hacker downloads more than 2.2 million of improperly stored account credentials from i-dressup.com, a social hangout website for teenage girls.

Author: Libyan Scorpion
Description: A cyber-espionage actor dubbed Libyan Scorpion is targeting high-profile Libyans, infecting their Android smartphones with a remote access trojan (RAT) known as AlienSpy.

Author: The Dark Overlord
Description: The Dark Overlord leak around 20 internal files online from Los Angeles-based WestPark Capital, as retaliation for the bank's CEO not accepting their "handsome proposal".
An investigation reveals that over 100 top US universities have been hacked and injected with SEO spam with the purpose of boosting the search engine ranking of an online gambling site.

Author: Hackers from Russia?
Description: Newsweek suspects that Russian hackers are to blame for the crash of its website, after it published an article about Donald Trump’s company secretly conducting business in Cuba in the 1990s.

Author: Fancy Bear, APT28
Description: ThreatConnect reveals that Investigative journalism group Bellingcat, that helped to investigate the downing of the MH17 flight over eastern Ukraine in 2014 have been targeted in a series of sophisticated attacks by pro-Russia group Fancy Bear.

Author: Vendetta Brothers
Target: PoS systems and ATMs across the US and Scandinavian countries
Description: A small, yet very sophisticated group of cyber-criminals named the Vendetta Brothers is behind numerous attacks on PoS systems and ATMs across the US and Scandinavian countries.

Author: pr0jekkt
Description: pr0jekkt hacks feverclan.com and dumps the data of 50,000 users.

Target: Large LED video screen billboard in South Jakarta
Description: An unknown hacker or a group of hackers hack into the computer system of a large LED video screen billboard in the Kebayoran Baru district of South Jakarta and replace the advertisement on the screen with pornographic content for a short period of time.

Author: Websites Hunter
Description: A hacker going by the handle of “Websites Hunter” hacks newseasims.com, a website that offers custom content for Sims video games from Electronic Arts, and leaks personal details of 118,000 customers/users.

Author: RedHack
Target: Personal email accounts of Turkey’s Energy Minister and President Erdoğan’s son-in-law, Berat Albayrak
Description: The RedHack collective claims to have hacked personal email accounts of Turkey’s Energy Minister and President Erdoğan’s son-in-law, Berat Albayrak.

Author: North Korea
Description: The South Korean government admits that its cyber military command was hacked last month by injecting malicious codes into one of its main routing servers.
A malware infection is to blame for a payment card data breach affecting at least 230 University of Central Florida students.

Author: Peace AKA Peace_Of_Mind
Description: In what is defined a "hacker drama", Peace, of the most known BlackHats defaces the forum of w0rm, another well known blackhat.
A website named ‘Bohrileaks’ releases the Ashara attendance records of Bohri Muslims around the globe—including names, cell phones numbers

Author: Russian intelligence or pro-government hackers
Description: Suspected Russian hackers are believed to have been skimming credit card information of Republican donors for the past six months. The NRSC is among more than 5,900 e-commerce sites victims of the same attack.

Author: Guccifer 2.0
Description: Guccifer 2.0 posts what the hacker claims are files stolen from the Clinton Foundation, but the foundation says the assertions are not true.

Author: OurMine
Description: OurMine hackers take control of BuzzFeed's website and alter multiple stories published on its site.
Multiple users report that popular music-streaming service Spotify serves malware-laden ads.
The Clinton Foundation warns donors about targeted hacking attempts to steal their personal information.

RiskIQ and ClearSky reveal that Popular ecommerce sites have been infected with web-based keyloggers being used to steal credit card data as it’s entered into online checkout forms. More than 100 compromised sites have been identified, but the number could be in the thousands.

Pont3, an Australian event organizer, reveals that an unauthorized party had gained access to its mailing list account and downloaded data about individuals that subscribed to various events organized by the company in the past.
According to the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) Director Yukiya Amano, a nuclear power plant became the target of a disruptive cyber attack two to three years ago.

Target: University of Toyama’s Hydrogen Isotope Research Center
Description: Research data and personal information may have been stolen from a personal computer belonging to a researcher of Tritium, at the University of Toyama’s Hydrogen Isotope Research Center. Attackers stole data in three batches: December 2015, March 2016 and June 2016.
Tags: University of Toyama’s Hydrogen Isotope Research Center

Author: Russian intelligence or pro-government hackers
Target: Several Russian activists and independent journalists
Description: Several Russian activists and independent journalists have reportedly received warnings notifying them that "government-backed" hackers may be attempting to illegally access their email inboxes.

Symantec reveals that a second group of hackers are attempting to rob banks by targeting SWIFT users deploying the same methods that led to the Bangladesh Bank hacking heist. The tools used are linked to the Odinaff group, which since the beginning of the year, has targeted financial institutions worldwide.
The DNS server records for blockchain.info and blockchain.com are hijacked

Author: 0x2Taylor
Description: Over 58 million customer records are stolen and leaked online. Data includes names, email and postal addresses, phone numbers, IP addresses and more.
Clinton campaign chairman John Podesta's Twitter account is hacked and sends out pro-Trump tweet. Several screenshots also suggest that his phone could have been hacked.
Tags: John Podesta, Hillary Clinton, Donald Trump.

Description: American high-end fashion retailer Vera Bradley has revealed that hackers may have accessed customers' card data from payment processing systems at its retail stores this summer.
Potter County officials assure users that their voter information website is safe after learning that hackers gained access to it.

Author: The Dark Overlord?
Description: Peachthree Orthopedic Clinic warns its users to have been hacked on September 22, even if several evidences suggest the hack could have happened several months earlier.
Tags: Peachthree Orthopedic Clinic, The Dark Overlord

Description: LeakedSource reveals that Evony Gaming suffered a massive breach involving the usernames, email addresses, unsalted MD5 and SHA-1 passwords and IP addresses of 33 million gamers.
Noble House Hotels and Resorts notifies guests of payment card breaches at Teton Mountain Lodge & Spa and Hotel Terra. The breached happened on September 5 and September 6.
A number of people at the Chicago’s Grand Avenue and Central Avenue intersection witness an unusual message on a construction signboard against the mayor Rahm Emanuel

Author: Guccifer 2.0
Description: Guccifer 2.0 is back and leaks new fresh documents relating to the US political system (documents allegedly showing email conversations between DNC employees and Hillary Clinton's presidential campaign staff discussing Donald Trump's position on his tax returns).
Tags: Guccifer 2.0, Democratic National Committee, DNC, Hillary Clinton, Donald Trump

Author: SCUWatch
Target: University of Santa Clara Office of Marketing and Communication (OMC)
Description: A hacker dubbed SCUWatch leaks a trove of internal documents from the Office of Marketing and Communications from the University of Santa Clara.
Tags: SCUWatch, University of Santa Clara, OMC, Office of Marketing and Communication

Author:
Revolver AKA 1x0123
 Peace
Description: A hacker known as Revolver or 1x0123 claims to have breached into AdultFriendFinder, posting two screenshots that appeared to show he had access to some portion of the website's infrastructure. Another notorious hacker known as Peace also claims to have hacked in, and obtained a database of 73 million users.
Online travel giant Ibibo Group-owned ticketing platform RedBus confirms to have been subject to a cyber attack that might have exposed the email addresses of some of its customers.
Axis Bank, India's third-largest private bank, announces that it was the victim of a cyber-attack, but has managed to stop the intrusion before the hacker stole any funds from customer accounts.

Author: Unknown Criminals from China?
Description: Details of more than 3.2 million cash cards of customers of top Indian banks (Visa, Mastercard, RuPay) have reportedly been stolen in what could be one of the biggest financial data breaches in the country. While it is unclear who is behind the alleged operation, reports suggest that unauthorised transactions can be traced to various locations in China.
LeakedSource reveals that the well known San-Francisco based "drag-n-drop" website creator Weebly.com had information on 43 Million users leaked from its main database in February of 2016.
According to LeakedSource even Foursquare suffered a massive breach (23 Million victims) on December 2013.

Author: APT28
Description: The cyber gang called Sednit, also known by the names Fancy Bear, APT28, Pawn Storm and Sofacy, allegedly believed to be behind the controversial Democratic National Committee DNC hack, is found to have targeted over a 1,000 high-profile individuals across the globe between 16 March and 14 September 2015.
Tags: Fancy Bear, APT28, Pawn Storm, Sofacy

Target: Single Individuals in the gaming community
Description: Symantec reveals that malicious actors are abusing Discord, a free VoIP service for gamers to distribute remote access Trojans, as well as infostealers and downloaders.

Author: FruityArmor
Description: Kaspersky Lab reveals the details of FruityArmor, a malicious actor exploiting an unpatched Microsoft vulnerability (CVE-2016-3393) in chained attacks.

Author: Unknown Nigerian Attackers
Description: The San Francisco Exploratorium Museum admits to have been fallen victim of a Spear Phishing Attack.
A distributed denial of service attack against Dyn, the dynamic DNS service, affects the availability of dozens of major websites and Internet services this morning, including Twitter and Reddit.
Forcepoint reveals the details of BITTER, a cyber espionage campaign targeting Pakistani government officials.
Baystate Health reveals that about 13,000 patients may have had some of their personal information compromised, due to a “phishing” e-mail that was received by some staff members.
The city of Middletown reveals that computer hackers gained access to personal information of people who had contact with the Middletown Police Department.
Singapore telecommunications company StarHub is the target of a DDoS attack (once again carried on flooding the company with bogus DNS queries).
A new DDoS attack hits the infrastructure of StarHub

Author: Syrian Cyber Army
Description: The Syrian Cyber Army claims responsibility for DDoS attacks against several Belgian media news outlets including De Standaard, Het Nieuwsblad, Gazet van Antwerpen, Het Belang van Limburg, and RTFB.
Tags: Syrian Cyber Army, De Standaard, Het Nieuwsblad, Gazet van Antwerpen, Het Belang van Limburg, RTFB

Description: DomainTools says it detected an attack against its user management system from an unknown attacker and advises users to change their passwords as a precaution.

Author: CloudFanta
Description: Researchers from Netskope spot a variant of a malware campaign dubbed “CloudFanta” which may have been used to steal 26,000 email credentials including addresses, usernames, and passwords.
Danish payment processor company Nets advises local banks to block up to 100,000 credit cards on suspicion their security might have been compromised by hackers.

Author: Moonlight (AKA Gaza Hacker Team)
Description: Vectra Networks reveals the details of the last campaign carried on by the Moonlight (AKA Gaza Hacker Team) collective targeting several targets in Middle East.
Tags: Moonlight, Gaza hacker Team, Vectra Networks

Author: Anonymous
Description: The Anonymous resume cyberattacks against Japanese companies, in an apparent protest against the resumption of dolphin and whale hunting in the western Japanese town of Taiji.

Author: Blackgear
Description: Trend Micro reveals that Blackgear, a cyber-espionage campaign that has historically gone after Taiwanese targets, has now shifted its gaze to its neighboring country, Japan.
Converse reveals that the company’s Australian e-commerce site was intercepting payment details for website visitors that made purchases between Sept. 2 and Oct. 12 of this year.

Author: CyberHunta
Description: A Ukrainian group called CyberHunta claims to have hacked into the account of an assistant to presidential aide Vladislav Surkov and uploads more than 2,000 emails.

Author: Anonymous Poland
Description: Anonymous Poland claims to have hacked the Bradley Foundation and dumps more than 30Gb data including a fake letter of a $150 million donation to Clinton’s campaign.
More than 55,000 Duluth residents receive letters informing them that voter registration lists and other personal information may have been exposed as a result of a phishing attack.
